column4: Hey, anyone know how to configure an AMP installation to work?  So far, I can't get PHP to work...
When I open a php page, firefox comes up and says "PHTML File, what do you want to do?  --Open With, --Save As"
Apache itself is working fine, though?
So do you know what might be wrong?
.php extension? Did you specify in apache.conf to serve php files?
Yeah, .php ext.  But how do I setup the apache.conf to serve php files?
check that you have php5.conf in /etc/apache2/mods-enabled
You should have a line: AddType application/x-httpd-php  .php .phtml
Have you tried restarting Apache? Anything in Apache logs?
What is the output of a2enmod php5?
It says AddType application/x-httpd-php .php .phtml .php3  And how do I go about restarting apache?
IT said something about unable to reliably determine the server's fully qualified domain name...
That's fine, don't worry about that
According to everything I've read, if your PHP files are still prompting a download, you may need to purge and resintall libapache2-mod-php5
Nah, it was fixed by assigning ServerName to "localhost"
